See America

Graphic Design
The Problem

Today, millennials are connecting to national parks differently. The small percentage that visits national parks are seeking adventure and connections with their community and friends. One of National Parks’ most prominent campaign, See America, has less reach than it used to.

The Solution

In an effort to modernize the face of national parks, posters advertising national parks were reimagined with modern aesthetics — clean typography and layout in combination with photographs with a romantic edge. I collaborated with Yaro Banduro (ybanduro.com) to combine his photography and my design to rethink age-old advertisements and maximize potential. The posts utilize the #findyourpark campaign, giving the hashtag a visual identity. The goal is to target millennials that seek adventure, community experiences, and that want to unplug via the very channels in which they are plugged into.
